exceptions.tactic: intro H; elim H; intro H0; elim H0; intro H1; elim H1; intro H2; elim H2; intro H3; elim H3; intro H4; elim H4; intro H5; simpl in H5; contradiction.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
~ (exists x y z : Z, 0 < x /\ 0 < y /\ 0 < z /\ rel_prime y z /\ distinct_parity y z /\ Z.add (Z.mul (Z.mul (Z.mul x x) x) x) (Z.mul (Z.mul (Z.mul y y) y) y) = Z.mul (Z.mul (Z.mul z z) z) z)

Premises:
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
distinct_parity = fun a b : Z => Zeven a /\ Zodd b \/ Zodd a /\ Zeven b : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments distinct_parity (_ _)%Z_scope
diophantus20 : ~ (exists x y z t : Z, 0 < x /\ 0 < y /\ 0 < z /\ 0 < t /\ x * x + y * y = z * z /\ x * y = 2 * (t * t))
domain_P1 : forall X : R -> Prop, ~ (exists y : R, X y) \/ (exists y : R, X y /\ (forall x : R, X x -> x = y)) \/ (exists x y : R, X x /\ X y /\ x <> y)
diophantus20_equiv : forall y z : Z, y > 0 -> z > 0 -> y <= z -> rel_prime y z -> distinct_parity y z -> ~ is_sqr ((z * z + y * y) * (z * z - y * y))
OMEGA17 : forall x y z : Z, Zne x 0 -> y = 0 -> Zne (x + y * z) 0
OMEGA20 : forall x y z : Z, Zne x 0 -> y = 0 -> Zne (x + y * z) 0
Zgcd_spec : forall x y : Z, {z : Z | Zis_gcd x y z /\ 0 <= z}
OMEGA5 : forall x y z : Z, x = 0 -> y = 0 -> x + y * z = 0
OMEGA6 : forall x y z : Z, 0 <= x -> y = 0 -> 0 <= x + y * z
OMEGA4 : forall x y z : Z, x > 0 -> y > x -> z * y + x <> 0
OMEGA7 : forall x y z t : Z, z > 0 -> t > 0 -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x * z + y * t
not_rel_prime1 : forall x y : Z, ~ rel_prime x y -> exists d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d /\ d <> 1 /\ d <> -1
not_rel_prime2 : forall x y d : Z, (d | x) -> (d | y) -> d <> 1 -> d <> -1 -> ~ rel_prime x y
intersection_vide_in = fun (D : R -> Prop) (f0 : family) => forall x : R, (ind f0 x -> included (f0 x) D) /\ ~ (exists y : R, intersection_family f0 y) : (R -> Prop) -> family -> Prop Arguments intersection_vide_in _%function_scope
infinite_descent : forall P : Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall x1 x2 : Z, 0 <= x1 -> 0 <= x2 -> P x1 x2 -> exists y1 y2 : Z, 0 <= y1 /\ 0 <= y2 /\ y1 + y2 < x1 + x2 /\ P y1 y2) -> forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> ~ P x y
gcd_rel_prime : forall x y d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d -> exists a b : Z, x = d * a /\ y = d * b /\ rel_prime a b
Rsepare : forall x y : R, x <> y -> exists V W : R -> Prop, neighbourhood V x /\ neighbourhood W y /\ ~ (exists y0 : R, intersection_domain V W y0)
Zeven_sqr1 : forall z : Z, Zeven z -> Zeven (z * z)
Zodd_sqr1 : forall z : Z, Zodd z -> Zodd (z * z)
rel_prime_oppr : forall x y : Z, rel_prime x y -> rel_prime x (- y)
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
sqr_poss : forall z : Z, 0 < z * z -> z <> 0
both_odd = fun x y : Z => Zodd x /\ Zodd y : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments both_odd (_ _)%Z_scope
sqr_0 : forall z : Z, z * z = 0 -> z = 0
relp_parity : forall x y : Z, rel_prime x y -> distinct_parity x y \/ both_odd x y
fast_Zplus_comm : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (y + x) -> P (x + y)
fast_Zmult_comm : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (y * x) -> P (x * y)
sqr_spos : forall z : Z, z <> 0 -> z * z > 0
multiple4_2 : forall u v : Z, Zodd v -> Zodd u -> v <= u -> rel_prime u v -> 1 < u -> 1 < v -> exists two : Z * Z, let (s, w) := two in (u - v = 4 * s /\ u + v = 2 * w \/ u - v = 2 * w /\ u + v = 4 * s) /\ 0 < s /\ 0 < w /\ rel_prime s w
OMEGA1 : forall x y : Z, x = y -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= y
OMEGA8 : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> x = - y -> x = 0

```coq
intro H; elim H; intro H0; elim H0; intro H1; elim H1; intro H2; elim H2; intro H3; elim H3; intro H4; elim H4; intro H5; simpl in H5; contradiction.
Qed.```
